poem:
Title: "The Usual Gridlock of Human Nature"

In the harsh landscape of the mediated,
where words circle like predators, eager for a verdict,
A journalist named Antoinette stakes her claim.
Her voice full of conviction, Sydney echoing her fame.
On both ends of the video link, silent mouths agape,
A stalemate written on the virtual tape.
Unyielding, the parties remain – a static dance,
In the ceaseless, unrequited romance of circumstance.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Antoinette Lattouf and ABC hit mediation stalemate in unlawful termination case Mediation in the unlawful termination case between the ABC and the journalist Antoinette Lattouf reached a stalemate on Thursday. Speaking outside her lawyers’ office in Sydney, Lattouf said the parties were not able to come to an agreement after entering Fair Work Commission mediation via video conference in the morning. “But the fight continues and I’m willing and prepared to fight for as long". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Antoinette Lattouf and ABC hit mediation stalemate in unlawful termination case Mediation in the unlawful termination case between the ABC and the journalist Antoinette Lattouf reached a stalemate on Thursday.
